thread.title: Pregnant Danielle Lloyd confirms August due date while lending support to children’s charity launch
thread.title_full: Pregnant Danielle Lloyd confirms August due date while lending support to children’s charity launch

author: Vicki Newman
title: Pregnant Danielle Lloyd confirms August due date while lending support to children’s charity launch
text:
Pregnant Danielle Lloyd confirms August due date while lending support to children’s charity launch The former WAG is expecting a baby with electrician fiance Michael O'Neill Share By Vicki Newman Lara Martin 07:37, 18 FEB 2017 Danielle Lloyd (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Danielle Lloyd has confirmed her fourth child is due in August. 
The pregnant model - who shares three sons with footballer ex-husband Jamie O'Hara - is expecting her first child with fiancé Michael O’Neill. 
She announced the happy baby news in a magazine last week, but kept her blossoming baby bump under wraps while attending a children’s charity launch in Birmingham. 
Danielle, 33, told Birmingham Mail that baby number four is due in August, adding: “It’s very exciting but I’m very tired. I don’t know the sex yet but I will find out if it’s a boy or a girl." Danielle stuck to OJ at the launch party (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Read More Is Danielle Lloyd reaching out to Bianca Gascoigne? Jamie O'Hara's ex wife follows CBB star on Twitter 
As for what her three sons are hoping for, Danielle said: “The boys are more hoping for a sister, I don’t mind as long as it’s a healthy baby." 
Danielle stuck to the orange juice while launching the Caudwell Children’s Ladies Lunch, which takes place in Birmingham on March 31. 
“I just think it’s so important – obviously children are a massive part of my life so being able to help other children is amazing," she added. Danielle said she's excited to become a mum again (Photo: Birmingham Mail) The star will return to Birmingham for the charity lunch in March (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Danielle says how she met her fiancé on 'Say yes to the dress' Share this video Watch Next 
The former WAG kept it casual yet sophisticated for the event, teaming skinny blue jeans with an olive top and fitted white blazer. 
Danielle took inspiration from Beyonce as she announced her pregnancy to the world. 
But the former Miss England has been targeted by mean online trolls over her photo shoot. 
The 33-year-old announced her pregnancy on the front cover of OK! magazine as she recreated the famous picture Beyonce used to announce she is expecting twins. 
The singing superstar took to Instagram to post the image of herself in a pair of blue knickers and a plum bra, with a veil on her head and surrounded by flowers. Danielle's pregnancy announcement with OK magazine (Photo: OK! Magazine) Read More Danielle is expecting a baby with her fiancé Michael O'Neill 
She used the image to announce that she was expecting twins with husband Jay Z. 
Inspired by the powerful image of one of her idols, Danielle made her own version in order to let people know that baby number four - her first with fiancé Michael O'Neill - is on the way. 
But the former WAG became the target of sick online trolls for the photoshoot. The comments have left Danielle and her family very upset. 
Danielle, who says she's hoping for a girl this time, posted the magazine cover on Instagram, saying: "So it's official Am expecting a baby. I loved this Beyoncé inspired shoot with @ok_mag #pregnant #baby#excited" How Beyonce announce her pregnancy (Photo: Instagram/beyonce) Danielle's rep said she's proud of the photoshoot (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
And some responded in a very negative way. 
One wrote: "How is this inspired??? U copied the whole damn look!!! The public does not care for u or ur child, it's no wonder u did this to be relevant!!!! Wow can't even come up with ur own style had to copy it!!!! What a joke!!! I'd feel embarrassed if I was u" [sic] 
Another said: ""Inspired"? You mean copied to the T, right?" 
"Good job copying Beyoncé. Sucks you can't have your own originality. Copying someone is the highest form of appreciation though I guess lol," wrote another. 
However, there were some loyal fans who jumped to her defence and offered her their congratulations. Danielle already has three sons (Photo: Instagram @missdlloyd) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
